views.markdown:
Enable native PiP in YouTube app.

If you encounter playback speedup issue for your PiP, try to upgrade to YouPiP 1.4.3+ (and enable Sample Buffer Hack in YouPiP settings) or use iOS 15.0b2+.

If you encounter "No stream Tap to Retry" error for your video, you are recommended to upgrade YouTube to the latest version.
- Added an option to display PiP button in video tab bar (credits to @BandarHL)
- Fixed support for iOS 12 (and probably iOS 11)
- Make Legacy PiP enabled by default for iOS 11/12 (regression fix for 1.5.13)
- Make PiP toggle displays for non-premium users on YouTube 16.40.3

- Known issue: PiP may not work on iOS 12
- Fixed crashing on some older YouTube versions
- Enforces legacy video decoder when legacy PiP is enabled

- Compiled with iOS 15.0 SDK
- Inject PiP controller into YTAutonavEndscreenController for better iOS 13- compatibility
- Fixed PiP controller not working on iOS 13- in recent YouTube versions
- Minor code optimizations
- Fixed YouPiP settings not showing on older versions of YouTube
- Fixed crashing on YouTube version 16.29.4
- Fixed YouPiP settings being unsynchronized when other native settings are toggled

- Fixed PiP still being activated when "Use PiP Button" is on, on app dismiss
- "Non-backgroundable PiP" option will only be displayed on YouTube versions that support it
- PiP button now shows or hides according to the setting

- Migrated YouPiP settings into YouTube's native settings (Settings > General)
- Added "Non-backgroundable PiP" option in settings

- Added backward compatibility with YouTube 15.10.4
- Removed potentially unneeded hooks
- Fixed PiP activating on app dismiss even when the mode is "On PiP button tap" issue introduced in 1.4.9

- Refactored logic around PiP activation via button tap
- Reworked settings page
- YouPiP no longer dismisses the app automatically when PiP is activated from the button because the legacy app assertion leads to PiP closing itself

- Fixed crashing on YouTube version 15.49.6 (and maybe lower)
- Fixed crashing on iOS/iPadOS 14.0-14.1 for YouTube version 16.25.2
- Force-enabled YouTube's enablePipForNonBackgroundableContent flag that may fix PiP crashing issue for some people
- Added Sample Buffer Hack in settings (iOS/iPadOS 14)

- Fixed app crashing on some versions of iOS/iPadOS 14
- Added a warning alert if YouTube version is lower than the lowest supported
- Fixed PiP not working on iOS/iPadOS 14.0 - 14.4 for YouTube 16.25.2
- Added few more missing logic from iOS 15.0b2 approach
- Attempted to fix PiP playback speedup bug using iOS 15.0b2 approach
- Enable native PiP toggle inside YouTube settings
- Refactored logic related to bootstraping PiP functionality
- Fixed crashing due to adding PiP button to the overlay for some users

- Fixed crash on YouTube version 15.49.6
- Added legacy PiP implementation in settings
- Removed armv7 slice as YouTube targets iOS 11 and above
- Added backward compatibility with YouTube 15.22.4
- "On PiP button tap" should no longer make PiP activated on app dismiss (iOS/iPadOS 14+)
- Added settings page to choose how to activate PiP
